results.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
results.creator_credit: Simon Perry, Umbrella Entertainment, Rosenblum Productions, Virgin and Michael Radford
results.brief_description: A bleak view of a totalitarian future that is visually faithful to the famous novel by George Orwell. John Hurt stars as Winston Smith, the man who revolts against “The Party’s” rules on correct actions, words, gestures and thoughts. Also stars Richard Burton in his last screen role, Suzanna Hamilton, Cyril Cusack and Gregor Fisher. Music score is by Eurythmics and Dominic Muldowney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simon Perry, Umbrella Entertainment, Rosenblum Productions, Virgin and Michael Radford

results.title: Nine queens = Nueve Reinas
results.creator_credit: Pablo Bossi, Patagonik Film Group and Fabian Belinsky
results.brief_description: Impressive debut from Argentinean filmmaker Fabian Belinsky, sees two con-artists link up, despite their mutual mistrust and misgivings, in order to pull off increasingly complex, daring and lucrative scams. This culminates in a scheme to sell a valuable sheet of stamps, the Nine Queens of the title, to a wealthy businessman. To do this the pair must continuously re-invent the set-up and its execution. Reminiscent of the work of David Mamet, Belinsky keeps the audience delightfully bewildered by the state of play as the narrative threads gradually unravel. An amusing and clever addition to the caper genre.

results.title: Nine months in motion
results.brief_description: Exercises for pregnant women. Contents include eating habits, benefits of exercise as explained by a gynaecologist, detailed showcase of several pre-natal exercises and movement techniques and statements by three women who participated in a pre-natal exercise program.

results.title: Nine lives
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Using multiple locations such as Bourke Street, school playgrounds and the beach, a group of students show us their acrobatic abilities, jumping off sides of wallls, sculptures and common school playground equipment.

results.title: Nine centuries of coal
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, National Coal Board and J.B. Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: The film tells the history of coal-mining from the 11th century until the present day. As digging developed, the hazards of flood, fire and poisonous fumes were added to an already dangerous occupation. The means to combat these dangers were only developed gradually. While following these technological developments, the film pays equal attention to the human factor, particularly during the period when women and children were employed in deep mines.

results.title: Nine and a half weeks (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Zelmain King, Isaac King, Anthony Rufus and Adrian Lyne
results.brief_description: This video explores the beginnings of mutual attraction between Elizabeth (Kim Basinger), beautiful and inhibited by love, and John (Mickey Rourke), impressive but strange, and follows the romance through the various stages of seduction, power, submission, rage and death. Their relationship lasts, predictably, 9 1/2 weeks.

results.title: Nimrod
results.brief_description: This is a documentary detailing the evolution of the jet engine. With the use of rare archival footage, we are shown the rapid development of aircraft design, in particular, leading up to and during W.W.II when Germany under Hitler was making dramatic advances with the jet engine. Rated: G

results.title: Nil by mouth [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, SE8, Luc Besson, Douglas Urbanski and Gary Oldman
results.brief_description: This is a raw, unflinching look at a dysfunctional family as it copes with alcoholism, drug abuse, petty crime and domestic violence in South East London. Gary Oldman’s brilliantly written screen-play and stunning direction perfectly capture the solidarity, resilience and humour that make survival possible.
